001
002package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node;
003
004import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.IAssemblyDefinition;
005
006public abstract class AbstractRecursionPreventingNodeItemVisitor<CONTEXT, RESULT>
007    extends AbstractNodeItemVisitor<CONTEXT, RESULT> {
008
009  @Override
010  public RESULT visitAssembly(IAssemblyNodeItem item, CONTEXT context) {
011    // only walk new records to avoid looping
012    // check if this item's definition is the same as an ancestor's
013    return isDecendant(item, item.getDefinition())
014        ? defaultResult()
015        : super.visitAssembly(item, context);
016  }
017
018  /**
019   * Determines if the provided node is a descendant of the assembly definition.
020   *
021   * @param node
022   *          the node item to test
023   * @param assemblyDefinition
024   *          the assembly definition to determine as an ancestor of the node
025   * @return {@code true} if the assembly definition is the node's ancestor, or
026   *         {@code false} otherwise
027   */
028  protected boolean isDecendant(IAssemblyNodeItem node, IAssemblyDefinition assemblyDefinition) {
029    return node.ancestor()
030        .map(ancestor -> {
031          boolean retval = false;
032          if (ancestor instanceof IAssemblyNodeItem) {
033            IAssemblyDefinition ancestorDef = ((IAssemblyNodeItem) ancestor).getDefinition();
034            retval = ancestorDef.equals(assemblyDefinition);
035          }
036          return retval;
037        }).anyMatch(value -> value);
038  }
039}
